greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Rectangular array A read by upward antidiagonals in which the entry in row n and column k is defined by A(n,k) = (2^a(n)*(6*k - (3 - (-1)^a(n))*(1 - (-1)^n)/2) - 2^n + 4)/6, n,k >= 1, where {a(n)} is the Beatty sequence A117630 defined by a(n) = floor(n*log(3)/log(3/2)).
comment: Conjecture: The array A contains without duplication all natural numbers m such that m < S(m), where the function S is as defined in A257480; i.e., the sequence is a permutation of A254311.
results.author: _L. Edson Jeffery_, May 03 2015
